extension.dc:title: Plinian Core Extension
extension.name: PlinianCoreversion3.1
extension.dc:description: The Plinian Core is a set of concepts that defines the necessary basic attributes to integrate and recover the information about species of organisms required by users specialized in biodiversity as well as users of other areas. This extension is supposed to be used in addition to the taxon core and the simple images, vernacular names and references extension.

property.name: abstract
property.dc:description: General description of the taxon. This concept could point out any information about the taxon. Its main goal is summarize the most relevant or attractive characteristics of this taxon to the general public.

property.name: AudiencesUnstructured
property.dc:description: List audience codes separated by means of comma or /.
property.examples: Biodiversity researchers, teachers and students, decision makers

property.name: Major
property.dc:description: The major version number (1 in 1.2) as defined by the content creators.

property.name: Minor
property.dc:description: An optional minor version number (2 in 1.2)

property.name: Modifier
property.dc:description: Unconstrained text specifying status + optional number. If missing, release status is assumed.

property.name: DataIssued
property.dc:description: Source for Dublin-Core standard element Date.Issued: Citable -publication date- of the current version (comp. RevisionData/DateCreated and DateModified for version- independent dates). This date should be missing if the current version is not yet published!

property.name: PreferredFlag
property.dc:description: TRUE to indicate current version when providers serve more than one record per taxon.

property.name: pubDate
property.dc:description: The date on which the resource was published

property.name: Scientificname
property.dc:description: The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of an Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the IdentificationQualifier term.

property.name: SynonymsUnstructured
property.dc:description: Different names for this taxon. This concept is a placeholder field.

property.name: NameUnstructured
property.dc:description: Different names for this taxon. This concept is a placeholder field.

property.name: DetailUnstructured
property.dc:description: Miscellaneus: notes attached to the taxon information. E.g. Pronunciation, etymology, ...

property.name: BriefDescription
property.dc:description: Brief description which reflect only the diagnostic characters, i.e. those that distinguish a taxon from other related or close taxa.

property.name: FullDescription
property.dc:description: Complete and detailed account of the taxonomic and systematic characters, i.e. those that define and allow to recognize an organism.

property.name: Keys
property.dc:description: Dichotomic or multientrance keys.

property.name: LifeForm
property.dc:description: General appearance. Characteristic mode of growth or occurrence associated to its environment, particularly for plants. Comprising its size, shape, texture and orientation.

property.name: LifeCycle
property.dc:description: Life history of a living organism: The course of developmental changes in an organism from fertilized zygote to maturity or stages through which an organism passes.

property.name: ReproductionUnstructured
property.dc:description: Data about reproduction of the species in wildlife or in captivity.

property.name: AnnualCycleUnstructured
property.dc:description: Set of changes or events that recurrently take place at the same time of year and are influenced by seasonal and interannual climate variations. For example: reproduction, flowering, fruiting, emergence of insects, etc. Also called phenology, mainly in plants. In the case of migration, refers only to the timing of it; other data about this are gathered in MigratoryData

property.name: FeedingUnstructured
property.dc:description: Information related to supply food for the development and sustenance of the individual and/or its offspring.

property.name: DispersalUnstructured
property.dc:description: The permanent spreading of individuals away from each other not including return. Dispersal determines the range over which genetic mixing occurs, and thus, the degree of homogeneity and inbreeding in a population.In unstructured format

property.name: BehaviorUnstructured
property.dc:description: Responses, reactions or movements made by an organism in a particular situation.

property.name: InteractionsUnstructured
property.dc:description: Mutual or reciprocal actions or influences. Relations with products grown and stored by man (plagues) are also included. In unstructured format

property.name: MolecularDataUnstructured
property.dc:description: Information on the chemical structures and biological processes at the molecular level: DNA and proteins sequences, protein structures, expression profiles of genes protein domains, families of genes, mutations, polymorphisms, involvement in disease, ... Undeveloped. Placeholder for connecting with standards developed by specialists. For example, Standards for Data Exchange and Management from Scalalife (http://www.scalalife.eu/content/data)

property.name: MigratoryUnstructured
property.dc:description: The regular, usually seasonal, movement of all or part of an animal population to and from a given area, which can occur in variable periods of time and even involve more than one generation. In unstructured format

property.name: EcologicalUnstructured
property.dc:description: Ecological importance of the taxon. (Placeholder).

property.name: EnvironmentalUnstructured
property.dc:description: Environmental ranges in which species live

property.name: HabitatUnstructured
property.dc:description: General description of the sites where the species are found

property.name: DistributionArea
property.dc:description: Description of the distribution of the species.

property.name: EdemismDescription
property.dc:description: List of areas presented in an unstructured and categorized the degree of safety.

property.name: TerritoryUnstructured
property.dc:description: Information associated mostly to vertebrates, referring to the territorial extension of the individual or of the group in terms of its activities.

property.name: PopulationBiologyUnstructured
property.dc:description: Study of the variations in time and space as well as size and density of populations, and the factors that cause such variations.

property.name: ThreatStatus
property.dc:description: Description of the threat status.

property.name: DirectThreats
property.dc:description: Conservation status.

property.name: LegislationUnstructured
property.dc:description: A national or regional proposed law or group of laws.

property.name: UsesUnstructured
property.dc:description: Known or potential uses of the species, at economic level, as instruments of education, prospecting, eco-tourism etc. It includes published material or suggestions from the author or others. In any event, the source must be explicitly quoted.

property.name: FolkloreUnstructured
property.dc:description: Known myths or legends that people or literature contribute about the species.

property.name: ManagementUnstructured
property.dc:description: Breeding and cultivation Control.
